This coffee really is fantastic, and I love the lattes. Add in a wonderful staff and a great location, I've hit no reason not to leave 5 stars.
author: Meg R.

description: We make a visit here mostly every month just because. The coffee the atmosphere and the people are true San Francisco. We love the taste of the coffee with the crisp SF wind and chilly breeze. Perfect place to watch the Sunday go by.
author: Jaye P.

description:
Perfect little kiosk at the Twitter HQ. Blue bottle coffee is consistent at every location. The espresso drinks are delicious and impossibly smooth. The pastries are delightful and they're the perfect companion to your coffee. 

Twitter employees and nema residents are so lucky!
author: Lynn C.

description:
What can I say? This is some of the best coffee on the planet. I live in New York and we have almost as many Blue Bottles as Frisco does at this point and, guess what, none of even come close to the quality of this place.

I know it is less glamorous than the New Orleans iced coffee or the cappuccinos, but the espresso at Blue Bottle is just awesome and pure and wonderful with that shot of seltzer they give you. Also the parmesan shortbread is awesome.

I miss this San Fran Blue Bottle so much. So. Much.
author: Paul A.

description:
Super good coffee and it has been fresh on both of my visits. The New Orleans Coffee is the Shizzel. Seriously, some dang good coffee and I will always stop by here when I am in the area.

I am a fan!
author: Nick H.

description:
What is the deal, people?! I was under the impression that Blue Bottle Coffee was the new crack. Geez, the way everyone talks about it around yelp, you'd think they had BBC dry out centers appointed by the courts. Based on my first and only experience, I was unimpressed. Frankly, I like it when somebody asks me my name or adds that extra special personable touch. I also don't mind paying above average prices for a great espresso. I don't feel that I got either at this place. A long line, with a cashier that had got a huge blue bottle coffee chip on her shoulder, and then a longer wait to get a super bitter shot of some mediocre tasting beans in a cup.

My apologies to all those die hard BBC fans. I've had better.
author: Cassandra E.

description:
best. latte. ever. also, love how they're in an alley with homeless people a few feet away. 

tips :
sell only whole bean and WILL NOT GRIND.
one size of deliciousness.
author: Jen H.

description: Cold brew is $4.16 including tax. It's a bit pricey, but a solid choice in the Hayes Valley neighborhood. This location is on Linden Alley. Staff are friendly and credit cards accepted. On a weekday during lunchtime, there was a short line, but manageable waiting time of under 5 minutes.
author: Tina C.

description:
I think they close pretty early, this little operation in the alley down from Smitten. It's a good place to grab some caffeine before you wait in line for Biergarten. Can't go wrong with anything here.

Cash only, the fuuuuuu...
author: Vivian H.

description:
Okay, okay. I'm a coffee snob.

I'm not going to write a long review about this place. It's just a little cut-out shop that serves cups of coffee... probably some of the best cups of coffee...

They are not too keen on customization, but they'll give you what they got, and that's enough. The service is succinct and sterile, but I don't need them to hold my hand and braid my hair--just give me a cup of coffee. For espresso drinks, what's frothed is whole, non-fat, or soy milk. 

I get a dry cappuccino with whole milk and it's pretty perfect. They have a small selection of pastries, and I get the olive oil short bread, which is essentially a healthier version of traditional short bread. It's sweet and short. 

Located on an isolated, one-way street, there are some organically-situated stone and wooden benches. They rest alongside flower beds where you can sit and enjoy your coffee, perhaps soaking in some sun. 

Cash only.
author: Alex F.

description:
I will give 4 stars for the coffee, but 2 stars for the service.
I loved it's Drip coffee, it tasted so good. 

The store located in an alley, which was hard to find a parking space there.
It was a small, cute coffee shop, looked very classical. There was no space to sit down and make a sip, only had a indoor stand table.

The only thing bothered me was the ordering system. We only ordered two cups of Drip coffee, the Barista even forgot our another cup. When we told her that we ordered two cups, she then made another cup for us and asked us to pay for it. We told her that we already paid for the two cups, she kept saying that she only charged us one cup at the beginning.  It seemed that her math was not very well. We ordered two cups of Drip coffee, $2.75/cup, we paid $10 and she gave back $2.75 for the change. We were so mad that the Barista charged us extra money, and then she thought that we didn't pay for the coffee but actually we did.

There is NO proof to show that you paid for your coffee because the coffee shop won't give you any Receipt once you made the payment.
author: Judy F.

description: Nice little coffee spot tucked away in a garage.  Very San Francisco.  The staff was very friendly, and my latte was above average.  More seating would be nice... there were only a few rocks nearby to sit down at, and they were all taken when I was there.
author: Kevin A.

description: Philz Coffee PWNS this place. Either lower the price or make a slightly larger drink.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
When exploring neighborhoods, such as the
Hayes Valley, you find yourself taking
a walk down Linden Street and discover
something cool such as Blue Bottle Coffee!

The staff are very welcoming as I decided on
hot chocolate and a ginger cookie.  Both were
very delicious, especially the design on top of
the hot chocolate (see pictures).

If you find yourself in need of any coffee type drinks,
a cookie or a treat, Blue Bottle Coffee will take
care of you  :)
author: W L.

description: Atomsphire is so cute! Very quaint, urban ,modern feel! Coffee is strong, but good! Price is good.
author: Marisa L.

description:
I had imagined that this would be a walk-in coffee shop, but it was a indoor/outdoor stand, that you walk up to, located in an alley. To get there we walked though a urbanesk/indrustrial styled area, in a very chillaxed atmosphere. Around the bend was a beer place with people socializing at picnic tables in a large area, there was a ice cream shop with a long line and there was a small grassy area with a cast iron statue of a tree and its roots, and there was a music band playing on the lawn.

I ordered a mocha, it was good, it had a charming design on the top that the bartista had artfully done of a heart. I also tried the drip coffee, which was just okay. The people there were friendly and helpful.

There were not any tables there at this coffee shop. In the alley there were some benches.

There were alot of people with their small dogs walking around there, probably because you don't have to physically walk into this place to get your coffee drink.
author: Tiffany Michelle L.

description:
This place is sort of a hole-in-the-wall coffee stand, and I would not have thought twice about going here had there not been the massive line of locals. 

I ordered a latte with almond milk. It was really good! However, I'm disappointed that they charged an extra dollar for the almond milk, without any warning (wasn't mentioned on the menu or by the baristas)... It's as if they penalize the lactose intolerant.  It just would have been nice to have known ahead of time... I have to dock a few stars off for that!

The total came out to about $5 including the almond milk surcharge (as opposed to $4). I'm not sure that I can become a regular, since I really enjoy almond milk lattes.
author: Victoria C.

description: This is my neighborhood place. The staff is friendly and always serves you at a good pace. I highly recommend this location to my friends. The line can be crazy on the weekends but understandable.
author: Bri R.

description: A gem in an unexpected neighborhood! Great cappuccino taste~ been hearing about blue bottle coffee and was worth trying! Definitely going back again. Just the right amount of creaminess and coffee flavor for my liking. Friendly staff to talk to was an added bonus of course!
author: Elena K.

description:
Don't think. Forget what you came here to order ..get the ICED coffee! The coffee has a great taste, lightly sweetened and you can ask them to add some milk that makes this heavenly concoction - thick and creamy!

You guys need to move to Durham!!
author: Ellie P.

description: Of the beaten path down an ally in Hayes. Nice people. Great cappuccino. Decent prices.
author: Joe M.

description:
I'm definitely a fan of the blue bottle coffee but the people who come to this location tends to be an appalling breed - those that need to try so hard to be hip and unique. One girl in line was asking the barista in a loud voice if she could make a "blah blah blah" - when the barista said no, the girl rolled her eyes and said something like: "I didn't think so, it's a Chelsea thing, you know, New York?"

I'm not sure what she was expecting ... for the rest of us to grovel at her feet over how hip and awesome she is? All I got was a twinge of disgust from throwing up a little in my mouth.
author: Gary Y.

description:
Please come to Toronto, Canada!

Must visit if your in town. I still talk about this coffee with friends. 

Highly Recommended.
author: Vik G.

description:
Fully deserving of 5 stars.

Service: The people running this are friendly and amazing. They were extremely gracious to the lady in front of us who ordered and ran out of cash, which shows that they are more about keeping customers then making tons of money (awesome).

Decor: C'mon it's in a garage how badass is that?? If it wasn't so popular it'd be kind of sketchy.

Environmentally Friendly: Recycling? Check. Compost? Check. Not having to use one of the paper cups? Check. Awesome. The world loves you back.

Coffee: DELICIOUS. Absolutely amazing coffee.  It makes me regret all the times I went to starbucks (seriously) because this place know's what it's doing. Delicious! 

Price: Fair, it's delicious coffee out of a garage if you wanted to pay discount prices then you should go get watered down coffee somewhere else.
author: Megan E.

description: While I still don't like their coffee, the company reached out to be directly and really is a standup company. For this, I would visit again (maybe this time I'll get a different kind)
author: Christine M.

description:
Coffee is good, but not as good as Philz so I can't give it 5 stars. 

I usually go with the new orleans iced coffee - I used to be a huge fan but somehow I feel as though the after taste of the coffee is always a bit off. Also, be sure to say light ice, makes a world of a difference with their small sizes! 

Latte art is always beautiful and I always enjoy my warm lattes, but they are on the pricey side, so the reason I usually end up here is if I'm showing off my cute little neighborhood (love the location of this blue bottle), or when I urgently need a caffeine boost. 

Tips:
+cute outdoor seating and mural art in this side street location
+walk down the street and hit up the middle of hayes (octavia/hayes) where you will find a park, tons of cute dogs, and numerous eateries
+try the double chocolate chip cookie here (might be called something else, but it's the dark chocolate looking cookie)- besttt baked good to pair your coffee with.
author: Anu P.

description:
My absolute favorite coffee in the world. I don't know how they do it, but their espresso is so smooth and without the burnt bitter flavor you can get at other places. Just perfectly roasted goodness. Any chance I get to have blue bottle I take it, even if that means going out of my way and waiting in line in the street. 

Just heard they're pairing up with Tartine, should be an interesting combination and am looking forward to even better (if that's really possible because their current ones are delightful already) baked goods.
author: brion p.

description:
I have been visiting this Blue Bottle location for quite some time to buy bags of coffee beans for my friends outside of California. This coffee stand operates out of a tiny garage in a nondescript alley that is hard to find for those who are not familiar with Hayes Valley. On my very first visit a few years ago I had to catch a cab and not even the driver had heard of the street. One thing striking about their beans is the fact that they embody a deep aroma that is complex and highly sensitizing where prolonged inhalation can cause long term stimulation like Viagra for those who wishes to try it.

Among a whole gamut of beans available from all over the world, my go-to cup is the Giant Step with soy ($2.50). According to their website Giant Step is a blend of Sumatran and Ugandan organic coffees that is quite dark and chocolaty. It has a thick fuller taste with a satisfying finish that is hard to beat. Their handmade coffee is so popular that I often find myself in a long line before I can get a drip. Fortunately there wasn't a line on my most recent trip in the late afternoon, but service was still distanced and they didn't have as many beans available as before.

The reason why I'm giving Blue Bottle a 4.5 stars rating is the fact that my top choice for coffee is still Philz. Although Blue Bottle has superior beans that are second to none, their service is not as personable and I often felt very rushed to making a decision.  At Philz, it is their duty to personalize each cup until it is perfectly satisfied. Here, I had to add my own soy and sugar and the nature of interaction with the establishment is much more transient and disconnected. In spite of these limitations, I'm still a big fan as their amazing coffee should never be overlooked or dismissed. They also sell their beans online so I recommend for any serious coffee drinkers to check them out: http://store.bluebottlecoffee.net/StoreFront.bok. It's good coffee to the very last drop.
author: Daniel L.

description: My girlfriend and I got a mocha and hot chocolate and I was happy overall. I would say that the price is a bit high and you end up having to like it because you paid a little more for it. The aesthetic of the shop is great and the simple design is what gives it the mass appeal.
author: Andrew G.

description:
a bit disappointing this time. I have been going to blue bottle coffee on hayes valley, mission area and the ferry building for years now, ever since they opened ...whenever i go to san francisco..

pleasant staff. they know "flat white" and made me one..but man, how did it turn out room temperature...i reckon the milk was real cold....
author: Mehran F.

description:
So so so so good. I get excited just walking up and smelling the aromas wafting down the alley, then taking a stroll around the little park, breathing in the sights and sounds as the coffee coaxes my senses awake.

The whole alley has the best feel about it for sitting and drinking your coffee from the bamboo to low slung slabs of stone for seating, to the flowers and painted coy.
author: Zack F.

description: Great coffee, new location right behind MidMarket. Friendly staff, nice location and an outdoor area to stand around and linger (though no indoor seating) - glad to have another Blue Bottle kiosk in San Francisco!
author: Sarah T.

description:
I love Blue Bottle! I'm not the coffee connoisseur, but I do enjoy it much better than Philz Coffee because it has just the right amount of caffeine for me (Philz can be a bit strong, though I do like their flavors too).

I really like the use of Tcho chocolate in their mocha.  It really gives it a creamy texture, definitely more so than Peet's and Starbucks (especially Starbucks).

I like to go once in awhile on those "mornings" during the work week.  Sometimes, it's the best part of the day.
author: Vira P.

description:
Tried the new Orleans iced coffee. Smooth and rich.  I bought the Bella Donavan for my coffee press. 

I recommend this place if you're passing through, but I'm still a die hard for  Philz Coffee.
author: Candy R.

description:
Disclaimer:  I like coffee, but I'm far too lazy to do a bunch of research to educate myself on the topic.  I'm a recreational coffee drinker.

I had heard Blue Bottle was quite amazing and stopped in on my way to campus.  It was almost warm outside so I tried the New Orleans Iced Coffee ($3.75).  The coffee was delicious and not bitter or nasty, and the girls running it were so nice.  Def a good place to stop and try.
author: Amanda J.

description:
I would recommend the ICE COFEE!

It was delicious but its small!!
author: Christopher G.

description:
Dear Blue Bottle Coffee, 

I love you with all of my heart. I don't know how else to tell you that you make my day everytime we meet. I love that thing you do... called the New Orleans. You calm my soul and pave a road of sunshine for me. From the Three Africans coffee grinds to the oranic milk to single counted cubes of ice to that brown paper jacket you wear with the blue bottle, I fall for you over and over again. I dream of the day we meet again, but until then, I want you to know I think of you all the time. My love is real for you.  

Love, 
Mike 

WORD OF ADVICE: Get the New Orleans. It's just the perfect iced coffee. I'm lactose intolerant and even I tell them to give me the organic milk :) #teammudbutt
author: Mike D.

description: I love the coffee and their location. Best atmosphere on a sunny weekend near the park. Sometimes I like chilling here and drink their cappuccino. I recommend their coffee, they also have good pastors and croissants.
author: Bob M.

description:
Don't want to say much because I think my fellow yelpers got it all down.

During a visit to the Bay, I got to try their famous iced coffee last weekend and it was super delicious. Cold, creamy, and refreshing. No sourness, just great, bold flavor. The service is awesome - just straight to the point - no bull. Can't wait to come back! We need more places like this in SoCal!
author: Lorraine S.

description:
I will not argue with all the other coffee lovers that say the coffee here tastes wonderful: my cappucino was rich and nutty with just the right amount of milk, and beautifully crafted with a coffee art leaf. But in my opinion, Blue Bottle made an egregious error with my drink - it was not nearly hot enough. I did recently receive a kind message from one of the owners explaining that the milk is steamed to a certain temperature to bring out natural sweetness...so +1 for excellent dedication to customer service! But still, if you're like me and prefer something hotter, be sure to specify when you order.

Other things to note about Blue Bottle: cappucinos come in short (8 oz) sizes, lattes in 12oz; soy substitutes are free; ordering is a bit messy if the line is long; bizarre location (literally a hole in the wall in the middle of an alley) so be on the lookout!

Overall I'd give Blue Bottle 3.5 stars...but personally, I'd rather go to Philz where my coffee is guaranteed piping hot every time.
author: Clarice W.

description:
This morning, my heart broke a little when I sipped on my Starbuck's latte.....

I didn't think it was possible to miss a coffee shop this much, definitely a first for me. I had heard that Blue Bottle Coffee was good, but I had no idea it was that amazing until I took that first sip.

My friends and I walked over 30 minutes to get here on a beautiful Saturday morning just to try their coffee. I ended up getting a soy latte for under $4! Was thoroughly impressed by their quality and their latte art! I had never gotten latte art before so I was extremely excited when my drink came with it.

Literally, I don't think I've ever had a better latte in my life. This place is kind of located in a small alley that's literally a hole in the wall place. But don't worry, it's easy to spot this place because there's always a long line of people waiting to order their coffee. And there's some small benches and rocks in front of the store for you to sit on and enjoy your amazing latte. 

If you're in the area and want probably some of the best coffee you'll ever try, come here!

Tremendous quality for the ridiculous price! Now everytime I drink Starbucks, my coffee palate cries a little.
author: Vicki L.

description: Great cup of coffee. I'm always seeking a coffee shop with a few basics: fresh, independently produced beans, organic dairy and proper brewing/preparation. Blue Bottle covers those, and will be my go to from here on out when in SF. I had coffee with a shot of espresso (often dubbed a "Hammerhead"), and it was spot on. Other drinks looked fantastic, with artistic designs, etc. Good ingredients, solid prep, friendly service. Check this place out!
author: Mick C.

description:
Wonderful taste and well balanced espresso, the milk tends to have great texture and consistently good lattes. Also a smaller version called a Gibraltar, which is the same as a Cortado, perfect for that afternoon pick-me-up.  The location in Linden is great, just a small walk-up.  The espresso roast they use is the Hayes Valley Roast which I feel like it is the best roast they have, very complex, chocolate and smooth.

Also please don't ask for flavors because you...just should not do that.  

The drip coffee is OK, not worth it for me... just stick to the espresso. Fresh roasted beans are delivered on Tuesday and Thursday if you brew at home, these are the best days to stop by and pick up a bag.  

Again, not a cheap place... but really worth the treat.
author: Frank C.

description: LOVE this place- not only do they have top notch quality coffee, but the location, plus overall interior of the small space is just perfect. Love the neighborhood, loved the coffee, will definitely return!!
author: Megan D.

description:
For coffee, to me, this is as good as it's getting. I ordered a capp, and it was amazing. I was literally doing a coffee crawl through SF, and this was my last stop, and I was at a point where I was beginning to hate coffee, but once I got my capp, I couldn't stop drinking it! It was smooth (and naturally sweet!). They definitely take care in how they make their coffee, as well as their steamed milk, because they brought out the natural sweetness in the milk, so I didn't have to add anything at all. 

The line is always long, but service is very fast, so you won't be waiting for long!
Needless to say, I will be coming back very soon.
author: Mikayla L.

description:
I don't understand. 

If you enjoy waiting in long lines for overpriced, commercialized, below average, "local" consumer goods, then this is the place for you!

O-V-E-R-A-T-E-D

The coffee is terrible. Blue bottle somehow managed to make me a cup o' the worst coffee I've ever had. I've had better coffee at a campsite. 

I have tried multiple times to "like" blue bottle, but each time I realize the coffee is just despicable. 

The new orleans iced coffee tastes like watered down butt-hole.
The mocha has a faint coffee smell, but tastes and looks like milk more than anything.
All of the coffee has a terrible burned bitterness about it and an extremely watered down texture and taste.

Not to mention, the employees are ice cold, just like your latte will be after you escape that brisk alley you've been waiting in for 20+ minutes.

I just don't get you Blue Bottle. I don't want to either. Nope. Not having it.
author: Alexandra C.

description:
Blue Bottle coffee is simply delightful. It is one of the standard bearers for good coffee for my taste. 

I had the awesome good fortune to stay near the kiosk location of Blue Bottle the last time I was in the city. At first I was hesitant about going there because of the hype surrounding the place. I decided to go ahead and give it a shot and I'm glad that I did. 

The TCHO mocha was the best mocha I've ever had, since the chocolate and coffee flavors were both well balanced and it wasn't too sugary. 

The regular latte was my usual order, as it was really yummy as well. The coffee flavor was assertive but not overbearing. 

It may be inconvenient to get to a Blue Bottle, but I will continue to make the effort whenever I'm in the city as long as the coffee is still that good.
author: Jessica F.

description:
Strong and decent coffee for sure. Iced coffee was good and the latte was made well with good proportion of foam on top. My only gripe is that they don't have flavored lattes, and I guess I'm just trying to find somewhere to make something similar to my Honey Vanilla Latte from Urth that it kind of disappointed me that they don't flavor any at Blue Bottle. But I can see why...you really enjoy the true coffee flavors this way for true coffee connoisseurs. Which, clearly I'm not...I just love me a good girly latte with an excellent layer of foam. But the coffee really tastes superb and goes down smoothly. However, I probably won't go out of my way to SF just to get this. If I'm around...

I'd be curious to check out their other location at the pier tho :)
author: Jasmine C.

description: To the quality of coffee is fabulous!! Great coffee!well, but as a new customer to the store, I don't feel any enthusiasm, more that I have seen is that they saying hi to their regular customers, and kinda ignored me and my hubby. I mistakenly took other customer's coffee, I admitted I am such a newbie . However, that lady seem like didn't accept my apology, and totally act like discriminating us! I am ashamed! Only that Asian serve lady did give me a good feeling! Other than that, awful experience I had in this store! Maybe not visit again! Thank you for all the great customer experience I had!!!
author: Rachel H.

description:
Drape on the coffee window, then sit on alley benches, people watch or take your kids to the nearby park. But wait, the alley is actually a street with limited one-way traffic. Don't let that stop you from Urban Parking in a spot. New Orleans iced tastes similar to PJ's iced coffee, which is one of my favorites on earth. Served non-bitter and slightly creamy. Excellent the way they serve it...didn't have to add anything.

This is possibly one of the best cups of coffee I have ever had. I find myself making up reasons to visit this place even though it is far out of the way from my normal visits to SF.
author: Luke H.

description: I love blue bottle, but I'm always into more local cafes. This location is in alley and has no seating, perfect for a quick coffee.
author: James T.

description:
Ambiance: I love that it's tucked away in essentially a nice shack on a small side street. It makes visiting it a little more adventurous and definitely provides a unique coffee experience.

Food: Their coffee tastes genuine and smells amazing too. I always get the mocha because I have a sweet tooth and I need coffee with a bit of sweetness in it, especially since Blue Bottle coffee is quite strong. They use TCHO chocolate in the mocha, which complements the coffee perfectly. It was the perfect mix of dark chocolate with aromatic, flavorful coffee.

Service: They make it really quickly and usually they'll make some nice latte art for you too!
author: Kailin H.

description:
I'm not from SF but when I came to visit some friends for the weekend, my only request was to try both Blue Bottle and Philz. Mission accomplished.

In a nutshell - cute coffee stand + deliciously smooth coffee + artisan prices. But i loved every second of consuming that drip, especially when it included a leisurely walk around Hayes Valley.
author: Sally E.

description:
I usually come here after hitting Chantal Guillon, a French macaron place around the block, and I always get the New Orleans iced coffee, which I think is amazing. I usually prefer my coffee black, but for the New Orleans coffee, I make an exception. It has a smoky chicory flavor, VERY reminiscent of Vietnamese coffee (which I also love btw). 

This location is very quaint and small, and it's more of a kiosk type set-up. A hole in the wall. It's can be difficult to find, kind of within the city block. They have little benches, where coffee connoisseurs can sit and relax. 

The coffee here goes well with the french desserts, so I would definitely recommend hitting up both places (Blue Bottle and Chantal Guillon) if you have the time.
author: Amy C.

description:
Only in SF do you purchase gourmet coffee out of a shack in an alley. 

Drip is the $h&t.
author: Mansi A.

description: Call me a fan boy, but something about BBC continues to inspire me to walk a few more steps, and pay a few more cents for their coffee. Deep aromas and flavors in each cup. I usually go for the drip, and black so as to not dilute the flavor. Come here for some truly excellent coffee
author: Vince E.

description:
I've been coming to this Blue Bottle location for years, and I think it is my favorite.

Even now that I live in LA, this is the Blue Bottle I choose when I head back to visit SF!

Located in an alley in Hayes Valley, it is about half a block from the park.

The staff here is always knowledgeable and efficient. I usually come for a hot cocoa, but I'm always bringing beans to my friends and husband. Whenever I ask questions, they always have the most thorough answers.

I usually take my treats to the park just a stones throw away, grab a seat and enjoy my beverage while people watching.

Also - their shortbread cookies are delicious!
author: Jess R.

description: After all these years, still a damn fine cup of coffee. Black. I have nothing more to say but I must continue writing for it to count as a review. Enjoy.
author: John M.

description:
Please tell me who doesn't love a random alleyway filled with innocent bystanders drinking copious amounts of caffeine in an attempt to start there day?  No matter what time it is Linden Street is always a popular SF destination.  The cozy garage door coffee shop is one of the best known places in the bay area to get your buzz on.

That little blue bottle is taunting for sure so even if it's your eighth cup of the day make sure to check this place out.  You wont regret it.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Blue Bottle was recommended (more than once) for me.

This is a converted garage, so there's no seating or anything.  But has a nice ambience.  I got their iced coffee (the sweet one) and it was just way too sweet for me.  A little disappointing.
author: Arthur A.

description: Tiny spot in a safe neighbourhood. Coffee is delicious of course. Baristas and crowd were impatient for those in the group who asked questions about the menu.
author: Cayla C.

description:
There's not much I can add about Blue Bottle coffee, so mostly this is for the service. 

I still love this location best. I only buy beans but boy do I take my time pickin' my beans. So last week I stop in and I'm eyeballing all the bags, and reading all the descriptions of the ones that aren't always on the menu, and they couldn't have been more helpful. Nicely checking in with me 3 or so different times to see if I had questions or needed help...all the while never stopping moving to make their coffees for the never-ending line that is Blue Bottle.  Finally I picked one, and I mentioned that there was a bean that I've been missing for quite some time and it was what hooked me on Blue Bottle, and immediately the guy said "Yemen?" Oh wow. Yep....that was it. They've had different versions (or whatever the proper coffee-talk vernacular is) of a Yemen bean over the years, but the original one I can still taste. Mmmmm. 

Anyway, picked my bag of beans, brought it home....and it was *okay*. The problem is they're competing against themselves with something that doesn't exist anymore and so they can't win. Not their fault...just my issue. So that's why I don't feel the need to only buy from Blue Bottle now....but if I'm anywhere near them I will stop in - and especially this location because they have awesome people.
author: Laurie H.

description: I get it. Its very expensive coffee with very long lines and rude staff. This is hipster hell. They had an 8 oz drip coffee for 7 dollars that took a 45 minute wait to get. If you like living like this, spending, money like this on COFFEE, then we aren't friends and you are dumb.
author: Andrew C.

description:
This place is my weakness.

I tend to have blue bottle at least once or twice a week and I can't stop having enough! 

New Orleans style coffee hands down my favorite! I need to try the waffle soon as well. CHEERS!
author: Adam J.

description:
Hands down one of the best coffee in the city! 

Although it totally sucks that there isn't one close to home, I'm willing to go out of my way for some good tasting blue bottle. Thank goodness they sell the iced coffee in a mini milk-carton-like container - Feels like elementary school! 

Love their lattes! It's silky, smooth and leaves no after-taste!
author: Jane C.

description: I absolutely love the atmosphere here. The open space, the cozy feel - sitting in their outdoor space with the fountains flowing on a sunny day is the best. Their wifi sucks, even if you pay to sit in the office space on the other side. But the seating on that side is super comfy and has outlets everywhere. Their kitchen closes at 3pm so if you're working later in the afternoon, tough - you're stuck with cake and cookies. The ice cream with espresso on top (can't remember the name of it) is heaven in a cup - you have to try it! I love this place!
author: Kelsey V.

description:
(See pics)

Review #1045.

Finally visited the original Blue Bottle coffee. A small kiosk in the semi-alley, the small relaxing line tells a tale of good coffee awaited to be perked and cherished. Because it's not in downtown, most come here to enjoy a cup and not to buy the whole shelf of beans to bring home.

The coffee is like music in the air.
author: T L.

description:
Really enjoyed blue bottle! 

I had the cappuccino which I felt didn't need anything added to it. 

I am removing one star because this place is a stand (whole in the wall) in an alley. There are some spaces to sit around but I'd prefer if the location was bigger.
author: Hugo V.

description: Blue Bottle's coffee really speaks for itself; high quality beans prepared by practiced baristas. Espressos for bar drinks are pulled in doubles, so if you're looking for a bit extra, a quad-shot won't hurt. I ordered a quad latte and my girlfriend, a mocha. My milk was steamed to perfection and they topped with some nifty latte art. Must go back to try some of their drip.
author: David T.

description:
This place makes me want to move to Hayes valley. 

Awesome baristas. Even when the line is long, they're pretty quick and efficient. 

I get the drip on days when I feel like being a bit more alert than usual and get a machiato or soy cap on other days. Their caps don't have too much foam, and is very smooth- exactly how I like it.
author: Namitha K.

description: Not really a coffee person but given all the hype, the coffee and selections here are very mediocre given the price.
author: Amir A.

description: Love this location! Thanks for making hot chocolate look pretty too!
author: Mariah R.

description: Go to Blue Bottle 1-2 daily (Mint Plaza, Sansome, Palo Alto) the service is impeccable everywhere except the Linden St = rude, rude, rude (female and white overweight guy in glasses are the reason I will never comeback to this location)
author: Nutty V.

description:
Tucked away on a quiet street you'll find A mysterious coffee joint that looks like its run out of a garage. 

I'm not surprised by the long lines even at 2pm. Their coffee is strong, bold and smooth, perfect for anytime of the day. Easily one of the best espressos I've had tasted but at a price. I couldn't imagine going here everyday otherwise I would be dead broke but it's a worth it once in a while. 

Also, you won't find any seating here so don't plan to camp here like you would at any other cafés. You may get lucky and get one of the several uncomfortable benches in the alley to enjoy your beverage but your best bet is to just take it to go or head to the park nearby. 

This place is hipster as hell and I think I get friendlier service at Starbucks but the quality of the coffee is worth the lukewarm service.
author: Jo L.

description:
There is no dearth of coffee shops strewn across SF, but this little nook is where  I love to frequent when i need to lace my blood with coffee.

A great drip coffee is what goes best for me while enjoying the outdoor seating on the  funky benches on a small side street of linden. The baristas are great and usually know what they are doing. 

Maybe try the TCHO mocha that everyone raves about or try some bites off the counter , my ginger cookie was sinfully delicious.
author: Akshay M.

description: Its fun to find it in the alley. Nice and small place and you feel the good smell of the coffee as you walk in. I ordered an Affogeto and a cafe Latte. The Affogeto was pretty nice I liked the taste if the Coffee mixed with Icecream. I would suggest you two ask for two shots as I think increasing the cotrast between the bitter coffee and the sweet vanilla coffee. The latte was also very nice but I would rather much less milk in it. I would suggest you asling for less. However, i think it was a great experience I would go there for sure again.
author: Salim M.

description:
My friend from LA and she wanted to try blue bottle for a while. I decided to take her before dropping her off at the airport since I also wanted to try it but couldn't find anyone to go with. The line wasn't too long when we got there and there were 3 girls working the machines. When we got to the front, the cashier turned around to work on something at the back table. My friend and I thought that maybe they were just catching up on orders since there were a couple of people waiting around for their cup of coffee. 

After 5 minutes of no acknowledgement from any of the staff, the cashier finally turns around and asks us if we've been helped. My friend and I politely tell her no and she responds to us by saying "okay. Carrie will help you when she's done" WHAT???? Why would you ignore us, then ask us if we've been helped, and not help us?? 

After 5 minutes of my friend and I looking at each other, one of the girls from the other side of where we're standing notices a regular who's standing behind us and asks if the regular wanted her usual, an americana. So not only is the cashier and the other 2 girls ignoring us, they decide to notice the regular and make her order before they event took our orders! 

Finally, after waiting what seems like forever, the same cashier turns around and takes our order. My friend ordered the New Orleans and I asked the cashier for half a pound of the darkest roast for my boyfriend. She gives our order in 2 minutes!! It took us 30-40 mins of waiting for something that only takes 2 minutes to make! No wonder there's a freaking line all the time, bc they take so damn long to actually take someones order. It doesn't make any sense to me why they would take their sweet time to take someones order when they could make the orders so quickly. 

The worst part of going to Blue Bottle Co is when my boyfriend opens the bag of coffee later on that night, he tells me that THEY DIDN'T EVEN GRIND THE COFFEE BEANS! The Cashier never even asked me if I wanted my coffee beans grinded  and just tossed the bag onto the table for me. 

In the end, the New Orleans was meh.. and we can't even try the half a pound since it's not grinded so all we paid for was crappy service from 3 hipster girls. The staff at Blue Bottle are seriously..too cool for good service...and good coffee.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Hayes Valley is so cute! 
I want to tuck it into my back pocket and take it with me! 

We decided to try Blue Bottle after hearing our friend rave about it wondering how it'd stack up to Philz Coffee (one of my husband's favorite Nor Cal coffee joints). 

He got their latte -- coffee came nice and tepid and tasted remarkably like
Philz Coffee's "Tesora" (Philz signature blend). Price is pretty comparable .. 
BB serves a smaller cup than Philz and is cheaper. However, with this particular location, you lose the ability to have free wi -fi, access to bathroom, or tables to sit down at. 

There's a short line but it seems to move fast and workers are really friendly. 
I think between Philz + Blue Bottle -- we'd prefer Philz cuz it's homier. =0)

... pst --- there's another one in the Ferry Building on Embarcadaro (little more parking friendly,  if you are so inclined!).
author: Mimi C.

description:
Hmm don't get it.. it around a 2.5 stars for me being 3 as my average.. I got a soy latte and got a mocha for my friend.. espresso definitely not strong enough.. almost got overpowered by the soy which tells you how weak the coffee taste is in the latte.. taste itself is OK..I think the worst part is the temperature.. it was just borderline below warm when I got my latte.. I gave my friend the mocha about 10 mins later in which by that time was cold.. he had to toss it.. I got two bags of beans sinCE the person in front of me bought a whole bunch.. hopefully they're good

adding an update for the beans i bought..
i would rate them a 4 or 5.. they're awesome.. maybe it's just cause i brew awesome coffee =P 
coffee beans are great.. definitely big difference from the latte i got at the store
author: Jenny Y.

description: Got a cappuccino today. Let's get real. Once you get to the top 10-20% of independent coffee shops in the city, it's all more of less the same degree of excellence. Pete's coffee is on par, and more flavorful in my opinion. I couldn't taste the minuscule difference this place is supposed to have for all the positive reviews. Fanfare around the city's trendy hotspots is really getting to be like the emperor's new clothes for me, all hype with little substance. So for just this level of coffee and price, I feel they should at least provide some place to sit down, but most of Blue Bottles are savvy on space and high traffic. Not worth the price (and the slight snobby service I detected) this morning. There's no bright customer service, just disaffected hipsters dishing it out, without even a thank you.
author: Bryan S.

description:
Blue Bottle Coffee was a stop on my list of things to do in San Francisco since it is so notorious. I now understand why! they have the smoothest lattes.

Just be warned! the line is long.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Every time I'm in SF, Blue Bottle is a must stop-by place.
I like their latte too but the best comes from actually a pour-over or Siphon black coffee. 
I'm totally in love with their 3-African blend. I get whole bean of Three African every time I visit Blue Bottle.
Baristas are really chill and friendly too.

Blue Bottle is probably one of my favorite coffee houses on earth.
author: Jun C.

description:
TCHO Mocha! 
Definitely worth the try, especially if you do not like Mocha's that make you feel icky because they taste like highly sugared milk. 

Cheers!
author: Manu M.

description:
The Original Blue Bottle on Linden -- still my favorite of the bunch!

I don't know what it is about this location that grips me more than others. Maybe it's the fact that the local coffee juggernaut got its start in this particular back alley garage? Who knows, but there's just a certain charm that encompasses this little hole in the wall, pumping out some of the best lattes in the entire city.

Even though the line can get crazy long, trust that they do a nice job of flying through in two shakes of a pegasus' tail. And if you feel like hanging around a while, at first glance it looks as though you have no other option but to take your cup of java and bail... but that's not the case at all. There are rock formations surrounding the alley on both sides that you can settle down on, and during nice days in Hayes Valley, it's a fantastic way to burn 20 minutes while catching some vitamin d in the process.
author: Ruggy J.

description: Great place! Came here on a journey because I've been wanting Blue Bottle Coffee ever since I heard about it from a friend, and it was definitely worth the drive, and the expensive parking. The place is super small, and can only fit about 5 customers, but if theres a wait when you go, its for sure worth it. The coffee was to die for, literally some of the best brew I've tried in a while. The ambience of the place is super friendly. When me and a friend came, it seemed like all of the other customers and baristas knew each other, and it just seemed very nice. The baristas complimented my shirt, and actually like sparked a conversation with me and my friend. I would recommend this little coffee shop any day for your morning coffee run, or just when you need a caffeine kick later in the day or something. So good!
author: Dmitrius R.

description: My BF favorite coffee shop in SF. Every time he visit me must go there couple of times. However, im not a fan of coffee, but love the environment~ and I also had my waffle and cake over there, nice~
author: Cayla L.

description: Love their coffee! Period. (Or exclamation mark;) ) great location to enjoy some sunshine in the city.
author: Maggie Z.

description:
Okay if Starbucks is the ex who always seems to be around when you need someone but leaves you with a feeling of regret every time you meet up, then Blue Bottle is being in a long distance relationship with Mr. Right. 

Literally a hole in the wall, I almost missed this place because I imagined seating outside but it's sort of just a stand in the wall. Seats aren't necessary though when there's a park just down the street with benches. 

I went today because my boyfriend is super into coffee and always talks about Blue Bottle so I figured since i was visiting home I would go check it out, I was coming over the GG bridge so I thought... I'm paying more toll than the price for the coffee but Yelp made it sound so promising, so here you go Fastrak, I didn't need that $5 anyways!

The guy in front of me ordered and then ran off saying he'd be right back, when his espresso came out the baristas were looking around for him as if he just made off with their money, they looked concerned with how far he had gone and then explained to me that after the espresso is pulled there's a small window of opportunity to drink it before it's out of it's prime. In turn I got to try a free espresso, thanks guy who ran to his car for money. Interesting enough they told him he should have just drank the espresso and then gotten money as to not ruin the espresso.... talk about caring about coffee, you aren't going to find that at any chain. 

Now here's where it gets good, I ordered the New Orleans Iced Coffee.....holy.....sh*t.......hands down, best coffee drink I've EVER had. I think I remember them saying it was just coffee, chicory, and milk, and yet it was so sweet, and smooth, and PERFECT. I regretted ordering an iced coffee the moment after I did, but decided, oh what the heck I already ordered and man am I glad I didn't say a thing because I feel like a crack baby, yearning for something I barely know but feeling like I need to get my fix before I head back down to San Diego. 

Oh Blue Bottle, I might be 23 but it's time to start a new tradition in my life, you are now officially a new part of my things-to-do-when-visiting-home-agenda.
author: Heidi G.

description: The Latte was so good, my Mom and Dad who are a pain when it comes to coffee love it too
author: Sandeep D.

description: When you are in sf for the day, you have to stop at at least one boutique coffee shop, which is exactly what I did. This fact may be surprising to a lot of people but I'm a San Francisco native and this visit was my first at a Blue Bottle Coffee franchise. I was really surprised how this particular shop was operated out of a garage-like setting. I don't know if all Blue Bottle coffee shops are like this one, but I thought it was cute. Getting to the actual drinks, I got a cafe Au lait, which was delicious and I'm VERY picky about my coffee. I also got an olive oil shortbread cookie and maple pecan cookie that both went perfectly with the coffee. If I loved nearby, I would come by here every morning. A great place for a pick-me-up!
author: Kunal N.

description: Love this place.. Coffee was delicious, price was just right. The reason I'm giving it four stars is because there wasn't much seating. When my boyfriend and I went they were busy, so we had to stand and drink our coffee. Not that big of deal I know but, would've been nice to sit and sip.
author: Marlene G.

description: Why didn't I go here today, dang! Oh yeah, because it's the only rainy day this year. Might swing by anyway for grab-n-go, these kids are awesome and so is the coffee. Love this kiosk!
author: Be F.

description:
In the category of micro-roasters or "craft" coffee, Blue Bottle can't be beat. The allure of the alley way location, standing room only, and limited menu is too enticing to pass up. There were only a few people in line ahead of my group as we strolled in on a sunny afternoon. They each had espresso and I had the "New Orleans" style iced coffee. Our drinks were prepared right in front of us, offered up with a smile, and did not disappoint. The espresso was roasty, sweet, rich and offered all the dark notes a great espresso should. My iced coffee was perfect, light, and needed no additional sweetener what-so-ever. It was perfect once we got back in the sun.
The caffeine buzz lasted well into the afternoon and left me longing for one more...
author: Sheena M.

description: Down the street from Smitten Ice Cream, hidden in an alley and inside a garage is the Blue Bottle Coffee. San Francisco always has its way for making divulge into iced coffees. My first love was Philz Coffee - Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. Now, I believe I have another favorite - New Orleans Iced Coffee. Mint Mojito Iced Coffee was refreshing, but New Orleans Iced Coffee had the perfect balance between bitter and sweet. The cup that it comes in is very simple. I can't wait to try more of their drinks!
author: Karla Marie D.

description:
They got a Square Stand so they take cards now!!!

I love Blue Bottle! It's so good. I'm not even a coffee addict or expert, but for some reason I can taste a difference between Blue Bottle and other coffees. I usually get to this spot around 8:50ish so there's only a short line. The workers are always really nice and courteous and they're VERY fast at making coffee.

The New Orleans Iced Coffee is my go-to drink when i'm not feeling adventurous because it's always good!

Most importantly, THE TAKE CARDS NOW!
author: Gregg H.

description:
OK, so I am addicted to coffee. I need my cup of joe before I can crack a smile in the morning or take coherent notes in class. 

BUT, i dont really know that much about coffee. coffee beans from some other part of the world that has a stronger something aftertaste than your regular starbucks....I mean, I understand the difference in taste..but i dont think i truly know how to differentiate or enjoy really good coffee...YET. but no better way to learn and discover than trying right?? :D I've heard rave reviews from friends, and after looking it up on yelp, i knew i had to go!! 

My wonderful friend brought me here and it was really interesting finding the place. It was in a cramped alleyway and was in what looked like a small garage. No other signs or indications besides the menu and a small sign at the front of the bar. Oh, and of course, the line. (I think if the garage-like door was closed, you wouldnt be able to know Blue Bottle was there!) 

There was something so charming about the place though. So neighborhood-y, down-the-block, no pretentious-ness. Wooden bar, simply blue sign and menu, and long line with dogs on leashes and what looked like residents of the neighborhood out for a walk. 

I ordered a latte and my friend got their drip coffee. I enjoyed the drip coffee better, because I felt like i could really taste the coffee. The latte was good, but was a little too milky for me and tasted diluted. (i expected more of a coffee taste.) So I definitely recommend their drip coffee! 

some reviews mention "New Orleans Iced Coffee" and that founds interesting!! I really want to try that next time.
author: Eileen K.

description: Place is BEYOND AMAZING. Line is always long, but it's worth the wait. If you're in a rush, tell whoever's waiting to wait longer because you're about to taste heaven. I'm serious. Blue bottle coffee puts coffee on a different level. I can't even put Starbucks, Peets, and Coffee Bean in competition with BBC. I'd say places like Stumptown, Verve, Temple, Intelligentsia, and Forge is probably in competition, but even then BBC is the BEST!
author: Gabriel C.

description: Great coffee, cute location! Wish they had more seating options, it is not really a sit-down place. But walking around Hayes valley is nice, smitten ice cream is right down the block,
author: Karen D.

description: I drink a lot of coffee. Best coffee ever. No other words.
author: Chai S.

description:
4 check-ins, huh?  I must like this place.  

K.  Not a fancy pants coffee connoisseur.  Not yet, at least.  

Disliked coffee since birth.... it tasted burnt or watery.  Turns out, b/c it was.  Fast forward to current, more educated me...  I've upgraded to Iced coffees.  Yup.  I move quick.  

Their Iced coffee is great.  I don't need to add any sweet or milky substances to mask taste.  It has a nice deep caramelized flavor that is a bit unique, but likable.  Reminds me of Caffe Streets in Wicker Park (don't worry Blue Bottle, your name is cooler).  

There are a few rare occasions when I think it's brewed a little too long, and the deliciousness boundary has crossed over to the bitter side, I'll add half a Splenda.    Which btw, can be gotten half a block away at the other, not as good coffee stand.  (Blue bottle doesn't have Splenda... goose!)



Cool location, worth checking out.  Best to walk here, parking is hard.  It's more $$ than 4 Barrel, but I think it tastes better.
author: CatwomanRoar M.

description:
I'm not a coffee drinker, and it makes my stomach feel queasy. But I'll that that risk on an off day, just so I can relax to a cup of New Orlean's style iced coffee.

Flavor so bold, it stimulates my taste buds in ways it's never been stimulated before. You can really taste the quality.

I also like how Blue Bottle was a local start up, originally from Oakland, and how they support other local places like TCHO in their mochas and Humphry Slocombe in their affogattos (in select Blue Bottle locations). Super cool.
author: Ray W.

description:
It's like someone hit the button on their garage door opener and decided to serve bitchin' coffee in the morning.  

The people here love what they do: making great coffee and conversation while serving delicious treats.  The ginger cookies are really fantastic. They're not for splitting with someone else; strictly one per person ;).  I've always paid cash here because i feel like a corporate sellout by pulling out the plastic.
author: Mike C.

description:
I was very intrigued by what Blue Bottle Coffee Co. was the moment I tasted their flavor of Vietnamese ice cream at Humphry Slocombe. I assumed it was a brand of Vietnamese coffee and I was surprised to see that they operate this little kiosk out of a garage in a random alleyway. The menu here is kept very simple. The barista must have been so confused when I asked if the drip coffee could be prepared Vietnamese style with the condensed milk. Maybe they have that option at the other location or maybe it's a creation of Humphry Slocombe? 

Anyways, I settled for a latte, which they do very well. I got a cool leaf design, which I haven't seen at my usual coffee stops. They also don't add the sugar for you, which is foreign to me. I do like that they provide organic sugar over the refined white stuff that I am used to. My search continues for really good Vietnamese drip coffee.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
This coffee shop is such a San Francisco treat !!!!! Starting from the attractive logo of the brand to their delicious coffee! They r authentic and they work with TCHO chocolates in some of their drinks! What more can you ask for?!!! 

The new orleans iced coffee was really good and refreshing! But the mocha with TCHO was my favorite! It has that bitterness of the chocolate and yet you can taste the coffee! Just a perfect balance!!! 

I wish they have stores everywhere !!
author: Ahdab M.

description:
I feel very fortunate that this Blue Bottle is so close to my house, I've got access to amazing quality coffee just steps away.  Awesome!  

Note that this location is in an alley, so there is no seating (just a bench or two) and they take cash only.  On a nice day get your coffee and walk over to the park, just a block away. 

They used to have the best soy 'au lait's' in the city, but they recently changed their soy milk brand to Pacific, and now they taste just like everyone else.  How boring. 

Is Blue Bottle the best coffee in the city?  No, I would reserve that for Philz.  However, Philz does not do espresso or frothed milk drinks, so Blue Bottle is the best for those types of drinks.  

Is Blue Bottle damn good coffee?  Heck yea!!!!  My ranking system:  Your average cheap breakfast with coffee that's sitting on a pot on a warmer is a 1, Starbucks is a 3, Ritual is a 5, Blue Bottle is an 8, Philz is a 10.
author: Evelyn N.

description:
You come and pay your respects to the original kiosk. The baristas are super friendly, stand in line before starting you day to tackle the challenges.  

One of the best cups of third wave.  Sweet, smooth cup of latte or cap.  Grab one of the small pastry or cookie.

(Don't put a lit on that latte, enjoy the latte art and sip up the foam)
author: Tony T.

description: The Mocha here is delicious!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Every time I queue up at a Blue Bottle window I am hopeful. San Francisco is world class in so many areas and how could thousands of reviewers be wrong? But coffee, like wine, is an acquired taste and I am still waiting to love this coffee. 

My best experience was at their location in the Ferry Building. I found the 'secret window' thus avoiding most of the line and then you get to enjoy your coffee with that amazing view. This visit was fun because it is located in an alley. I thought for sure the map was wrong, then I saw the line. Kind of like a speakeasy for coffee. 

Hayes Valley is a great neighborhood so it is lovely to window shop while drinking your coffee, but of all the places I visited in S.F., this was the least enjoyable.
author: Jen K.

description:
This place frustrates the hell out of me

Their coffee is delicious

They can never seem to serve it to me hot

Always barely warm

Yet I keep coming back

..........
author: Frank J.

description:
After all the ice creams and macarons, time for something to drink --- off to Blue Bottle. Man, i would not have imagined that in this little alley there will be a coffee shop / stand. If i were to describe this place.. it's like little kids opening up a lemonade stand in front of their parents' garage. In this case.. it's fresh brewed coffee / latte / cappuccino.  

As you walk toward Blue Bottle from the start of the alley way, you can smell the coffee aroma --- SOOO fragrant!!! And then you notice a line of people. 

i myself ordered their cafe latte cuz i wanted the art. haha but Eric L. ordered their Giant Steps - and it was mmmmm! The aroma and taste of Giant Steps totally overpowered the latte. When i drank my latte again, it seemed tasteless. 

Cant wait to go back to SF for another cup of Blue Bottle.
author: Cherie T.

description:
Goddamn, I'm so addicted.

I started subscribing to their coffees on order since I don't live in the city.  Yesssss, deliveries every 2 weeks, and I can make it at home EVERY DAY!

This is a great location still and just a walk away from my local boy scout's living quarters.
author: Ruth C.

description:
This place was so fricken zen. Every morning on my trip I'd stop by and feel like I was in the secret garden. With all the world's cutest dogs.

I noticed that all of these adorable coffee places in SF always offer soy milk but no vegan pastries. Which would go awesome with this coffee. 

Anyway...awesome stuff. I miss it! Whole beans are pricey ($9-12 a half pound) but we brought some home/to huff on the plane.
author: Allyson D.

description:
Delicious iced coffee and prompt service. Definitely my favorite iced coffee ever. They have some cute benches outside to sit on on a nice day. 

Try the coffee. It's amazing I tell you.
author: Sneha P.

description: Blue Bottle is a coffee roaster, originating from Oakland and housing 7 Bay Area locations as well as 7 East Coast locations and one LA one. The Hayes Valley location is in a back-alley near a thriving shopping and food area. The espresso blends are generally lighter than that of any other third wave coffee roaster. Temperature control lies in the cooler side.
author: Jay C.

description:
I definitely prefer this location over any other blue bottle location. They make the best NOLAs and mochas. 

Come here on a sunny day and enjoy the weather, walk around Hayes with your blue bottle in hand! 

Downside: 
-the line is usually long, but worth the wait! 
-parking sucks (but that's sf for you!)
author: L F.

description:
Cute little location -- in a cute little alley next to Dark Garden (that will have to be another review for another day).  

Long line.  Make sure you have plenty of coins in the meter because this place is always crowded.  

Great coffee.  We ordered the drip, took a long time since they make each cup separately.  But oh it was so good and I'm not even that big a of a coffee fan.

Beans.  They have ready to purchase beans packed if you are looking to bring some of that Blue Bottle goodness home.  Although, there were like 10 options.  If you tell them what you like, the machine you have, the type of drinks you'll make, they can recommend.  

Caffeine.  Don't forget that these little cups of goodness are full of something that will keep you awake -- we had ours around 2 pm and I think I was up until 2 am!

Can't wait to order another cup.
author: Cindy C.

description:
On my 200th review, this coffee shop should've been in my earlier reviews.

After a long, but delicious morning at Dottie's, we went to Blue Bottle coffee shop in Hayes Valley for a quick perk for the afternoon. My daughter ordered a hot chocalate, which is what she likes. I ordered a awesome $4.00 cup of mocha. This is my daughter's first ever visit to the coffe shop, and say won't be her last. Her hot-chocolate was her true-love of the day. My great-tasting mocha is the richest and tastier than most corporate joe's spots.
author: Matt G.

description:
Since this is a booth-ish place, it's dog friendly. They have dog biscuits on the edge of the bar area. Located in an alley. Service wasn't bad but wasn't great either. Expect a line. So the 3 stars is strictly because I paid 3.75 for a lukewarm caffe latte. Maybe I just had high expectations because my best friend boasts about this place. Decent and I had no caffeine buzz at all. But I will try this place again and leave an update. 

P.S. CASH ONLY. and there is no visible sign that says so. Thank god I keep cash on me or I would've waited for no reason!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Blue Bottle Coffee,
Move to Chicago & Milwaukee!

I miss your lattes with soy.
They bring me happiness and joy!

Please come to the Midwest!
You are truly better than the rest!
author: Patricia M.

description: Their mochas are a little bit of heaven in a cup. Silky, smooth coffee-chocolate goodness with a foam heart on top. Highly reommended.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Amazing coffee.  You want fresh?  The beans are roasted within 48 hours of getting to you, then they are ground just moments after you place your order.  You may wait a little longer than the chains, but you can taste the care and quality.

At first my individually prepared drip coffee seemed like a lightweight due to the low acidity, but the more I sipped I could appreciate it's depth and complexity.  It reminded me of Kona and Jamaican Blue Mountain coffees - not bad company.

They also use TCHO chocolate, a locally produced chocolate, which is nothing like stuff from Pennsylvania or the nearby wharf - it's serious chocolate.  I tasted a Mocha and a Hot chocolate and they were only slightly sweet; the chocolate is all about the highlighting the cocoa flavor.  Something to note is that a child will not find the Hot Chocolate to be as familiar tasting as they are used to.

The baristas are friendly and courteous, and most of all, they seem to really enjoy their job and perform their coffee making with deliberate care and skill. The coffee drinks themselves might be high brow, but there's nothing about the staff that creates a snobby vibe.
author: Jason C.

description:
Convenient and OG. Quality is just as solid as the Mint & Ferry building locations. FYI this location is CASH ONLY. 

I won't go into a detailed rating for this specific location since I already wrote a full review for Blue Bottle at the Mint building:
http://www.yelp.com/biz/blue-bottle-coffee-co-san-francisco-7#hrid:ew7kXaOAFOr3FlOCEeWjbQ/src:self
author: Fouzi H.

description:
Can't say enough about Blue Bottle.  See all the reviews.

Latte and Au Lait always made perfectly.   Never disappoints!
author: AJ B.

description:
No Equal or Splenda here - just organic sugar.

Ever since reading Chronicle's article about some cafes in the town offering individually dripped coffee, I wanted to try it.  After waiting 3-4 minutes after ordering one at Blue Bottle, I found that it was sure was good, but only as good as a 'fresh' coffee at a quality cafe.  What single-serve dripped coffee brings is consistency; you will know every time that you are getting a fresh cup of coffee without worrying that you are pumping out the stale coffee from bottom of the pot.
author: トモ T.

description: What is it with sour coffee in San Francisco?? This was the second coffee place I went to this afternoon - after I threw out a cup of Ritual, nearby. I had to throw this one out as well, for its bitter, sour top and after notes. Really undrinkable.
author: Booklover F.

description:
Alright I know I've been to the other blue bottle in the ferry building but this one seems to have a better vibe to it. Something about getting your coffee from an alleyway makes it seem that much more legit (not shady at all). 

This time I got the soy mocha that so many people have been raving about. My initial reaction was "$4.75 for a small mocha are you serious??" Although it is on the pricier side, this has got to be my favorite cup of mocha I have ever had. The chocolate is from TCHO (a local sf chocolate company) and that made sense to why the mocha was so expensive (TCHO chocolate is EXPENSIVE)

the design on top of the coffee was pretty cool too. it was in a leaf shape and I was impressed how effortlessly the barista did that.

will I come here again? yes but the high price for coffee makes me not want to go here too often
author: Spencer E.

description: Feels like I'm back in Seattle - a hidden coffee shop that takes the espresso straight to my heart, wakes me up, yet relaxes my soul. Yummm!
author: Regina D.

description: Came here for my third coffee stop of the day, and usually as the day goes on, the coffee effect gets weakened. But this place still managed to hit the spot! Had such an interesting taste, and of course I love that foam art.
author: Kristen K.

description: I have been a loyal customer of this location for a very long time. The last few visits I was served hot drinks at a room temperature. Not sure if it is a trend but good capuchino is ruined if not hot aka 3 stars.
author: Jada C.

description:
I work in the coffee industry and I've tried dozens of so called specialty coffee shops all over the world. Blue Bottle is the best I've had. 

Get the single origin espresso or a single origin coffee brewed in a Nel. Or both. You won't regret it. The coffee was obsessively prepared and the result was - hands down - the best coffee I've ever had in a coffee shop. 

This place is worth the line out the door. Decor and ambience (often a sticky point with specialty shops) were perfect for a quick cup or a focused laptop session (with headphones as its buzzing with conversation all the time). My favorite touch was the water reservoir by the door - perfect for filling my steel water bottle for the next leg of my city crawl. :)
author: Nate J.

description: I'm very fortunate to have this awesome coffee place on my way to work. Always fast and great service. Having a morning drip here is the best possible start of the day
author: Petter B.

description:
I love hole in the walls especially when they serve amazing coffee from a garage. 

There's always a long line but well worth the wait. I've tried the mocha, hot chocolate, New Orleans iced coffee but my favorite would definitely be the latte. They are always really nice and friendly and the coffee is pricey but for such awesome coffee, it is worth it!
author: Katie M.

description: Their New Orleans style iced coffee is amazing, and the workers were wonderful. 10/10
author: Grant K.

description: New people who aren't good at making coffee and very stringent about small changes to the order.
author: Faisal D.

description:
Blue Bottle, I love you.

Original location. Tucked away in an alley off the main path. The line can get long, but it goes rather quickly. Seating is limited to small benches and rocks, but there is a park nearby with lots of seating. Cash only.

New Orleans style iced coffee. Mildly sweet with a hint of chicory. Rich, refreshing and so delicious. Consistently good espresso. You really can't go wrong with anything here.
author: Ashley K.

description:
Consistently the best coffee in the area. I always regret it whenever I go somewhere other than Blue Bottle! (This is the part where I should say that I work around the corner). All my coworkers and I are totally addicted! I'm usually a mocha person, but don't care for the taste or the price at BB so I usually go for a cappuccino or a latte, although the ice coffee is absolutely delicious as well! I had a drip coffee once and was not a fan.

The service is so/so. The baristas used to be much snobbier, but are either more relaxed now or are getting used to seeing me around. Don't expect a smile from them, but they make damn good coffee which is what counts. The baked goods are good too as an extra treat.

As most others have mentioned, it is cash-only. There are days when I go to the ATM simply for the privilege of getting a Blue Bottle fix.

They have "seating" in the alley in the form of rock benches, but it is technically a street, so cars can come by and nip at your toes.

edit 6/2014: this review is now out-of-date! It's no longer cash-only, they can take cards now.
author: Isabelle M.

description:
Dear Blue Bottle,

Please forgive me for trying Ritual. It was a moment of weakness and curiosity. You're still the best coffee I've ever had. 

I'm so sorry!
Maria

P.S.  Bella Donovan - Love it!!!
author: Maria S.

description:
Yes, it is cash only. Yes, it is a shack. Yes, the line is always long. Yes, the sizes are small. Yes, it is kind of hard to find and definitely hard to park.

But real talk: the New Orleans Style Iced Coffee from Blue Bottle is IN FACT what heaven tastes like. You just can't argue with that.
author: Haley B.

description:
For years I looked at coffee as a necessary evil, something I drank to stay awake even though I despised the taste. And who could blame me? Bitter, harsh, and not the least bit enjoyable, I sucked it down only by virtue of adding almost equal parts of milk and sugar.  

So a few years ago when I stumbled across this Blue Bottle in Hayes Valley, it was a seminal moment. Like in the Shogun's Assassin, that was the night everything changed, and I realized good coffee wasn't bitter, but rather smooth, clean, and delicious.  

So while my wallet may look back with nostalgia at my state of pre-Blue Bottle primordial ignorance--when a $1.25 cup of coffee was wholly acceptable--I know there's no going back.
author: Ryan S.

description:
It was the best coffee I have ever had! 
But now...  I cannot enjoy any other coffee that I have been enjoying up until that unfortunate day when my friend introduced me to Blue Bottle... Blue Bottle coffee has ruined me for all other coffees...
I cannot stop thinking about it... I want it... I long for it...
author: Marina K.

description:
Addicting, friendly service, and always consistent with their drinks. Need I say more? Aside my dog get's to score a free treat while I stop by.

Anddd it's true! They're finally accepting credit cards! Not that I totally went out of my way to get cash to get my coffee fix... I mean I never went to the Walgreens nearby or anything to get cash back after buying some random cheapy item just so I can run back to Blue Bottle for my coffee...... nope, never happened. :)
author: Sydney M.

description:
There's almost always a line, but once you've ordered, you're good to go. Excellent customer service and bomb Vietnamese drip coffee and soy lattes.

Pricey for a cup o' coffee, but it's no worse than any other local joint. A must try for those who insist that Starbucks is the epitome of good coffee. Because really... It's not.
author: Colleen M.

description:
Friend brought me to this place to try, individual drip coffees and boy it was good. For 2 bucks that is not bad at all.

2nd time I came here, I tried the New Orleans style iced coffee and this was amazing.  The coffee was rich and bold and it was very smooth.  This place is good if you are a coffee lover, caution you might get addicted!

Every time I come, there is a line but the line goes quick.

- Parking-

Parking is a bit rough it's busy and sometimes they workers there don't like it when you park in front of the shop, they get anal about it.  There are parking on linden street but you might have to park a block or so away.
author: Kenneth Y.

description:
They know coffee. And they know it well. 

This is my favorite Blue Bottle location because you order + wait for your coffee in the open air, and there's a small park close by with a mini play area where you can enjoy your drink and a book. Results in a dog- and kid-friendly coffee run. Plus, if you're a visitor, you truly feel like you're part of the local life at this location.

Their drip is more on the acidic side if you're a fan of that. I'm not so much a fan considering i like to enjoy my drips black.  

Cash only at this location--i forget this sometimes. wish they were more card friendly. cash isn't so fun as i dislike carrying it around.
author: Kimberly ..

description:
Alright, the New Orleans style ice coffee is the best crack I've ever had in my life.  Bombtastic and gets all you coffee freaks a nice tingle up and down your pants. 

This location is actually my favorite.  Something about how its laid out in the middle of this small street.  Makes me feel a little more snooty about my fantastic coffee.
author: Nho C.

description:
I want to give it 4 stars one morning and 2 stars the next.

I order the drip and when it's HOT and a FULL it's one of the best.

What bothers me is that my coffee is just warm, not hot half the time and for a smaller cup than most other places it really annoys  me when it's 3/4 full! I've asked for no room for cream, but seem to get the same amount. The other thing that bothers me is the ordering system. You have to kinda leave it in the Barista's hands that they remember the order of people ordering. Well I've had people swipe my coffee on a few occasions and it's a bit uncomfortable to call someone out for taking your coffee out of order.
author: MARCUS L.

description:
I'm loving this hole-in-the-wall coffee business. 

I was super excited to try this place and see the latte art they do, but I ordered the iced coffee instead which doesn't really work with latte art. :(
author: Jeanette S.

description: Worth the line. They are that good at what they do! Great spot to go to with the corset shop next door and the lovely plaza to sit by. Terrible place to find parking though. Better off parking uphill or just walking to this hood, or else you have someone side park while the other gets the coffees.
author: Kristina B.

description: quality standard, smooth, never acidic.. almond milk latte treat once a month!
author: Caroline L.

description: Great pop up in some green space with ice cream around the corner.
author: P T.

description: Coffee did not live up to hype.
author: Jessica P.

description: On a recent trip to San Francisco I had the opportunity to try Blue Bottle Coffee both hot and iced. The hot coffee was a mild blend that woke me up slowly on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. Later on I had iced coffee with soy and it was the best iced coffee I have had ever! Not to mention the soy milk they used blended perfectly and complimented the flavor quite well. Oh and the shop is so cute! It's like in a garage almost and there are cute benches to sit on outside.
author: Laura B.

description:
I am a fan of Blue Bottle Coffee, and the fact that this location is so close to Smitten, makes me very happy!  I am able to pop over and grab a cup to wash down all that delish ice cream. 

I am usually a black coffee drinker, but I have a soft spot for the Cafe Au Laits at blue bottle. I'm not sure why or how they make it slightly better than the rest (I suspect it's the awesome coffee they start with) but it's definately heaven to have.
author: Samanta V.

description: I had time to kill in the city so I took a walk searching for a place to get a good cup of coffee. I saw a line in front of this place down the alley and decided to try it out. Was not disappointed! The latte I ordered had perfectly steamed milk and the espresso was delicious.
author: Lindsay C.

description: Cappuccino, New Orleans style iced coffee, black coffee. Tiny stand on Linden; can sit on the curbs out front or take coffee to the park at the end of Linden at Octavia. Friendly staff, great coffee for true coffee drinkers.
author: Sarah V.

description:
I have to admit this must be one of the best coffee . Cream and espresso to die for! 
Just the right amount. I wish they would open in Houston Texas. Beats Starbucks by a landslide ! 
Can't wait to go back to SF and get some blue bottle :)
author: Thang H.

description: Tasty coffee and very friendly.  Love the settings. Definitely a good place to take a break from the office.
author: Tkd K.

description:
I feel like there might be some sort of war between Blue Bottle and Philz Coffee, and if there is I am fighting on Philz side until everyone converts. Wow, that sounded kind of horrible, but I am very firm on my belief that Philz is better.

I'm a bit of a coffee snob. I think it's kind of well-known within my circle of friends that I love coffee. One day I got a reaction from a friend that was something like, "Oh you go to Philz Coffee every morning? I've never been but I LOVE Blue Bottle and it's seriously THE BEST!"
